name: Pluritine Church
description: Dominant monotheistic religion of the mortal folk of Dolmenwood; an evangelistic church of one God and many saints, wielding political influence and holy military orders.

enclaves.name: Church of St Gondyw
enclaves.summary: Impressive (and overly large) village church dedicated to St Gondyw.

enclaves.name: Cathedral of St Signis
enclaves.summary: Mighty cathedral dominating the Inner City; core of Pluritine administration in Dolmenwood.

enclaves.name: Bishop’s Palace

enclaves.name: Seminary of 100 Martyrs
enclaves.summary: Headquarters of the Order of St Faxis; theological libraries; training new priests.

enclaves.name: Church Lands

enclaves.name: Chapel of St Lillibeth

enclaves.name: Church of St Waylaine
enclaves.summary: Rambling church dedicated to St Waylaine in Prigwort.

enclaves.name: Refuge of St Keye
enclaves.summary: Only remaining monastery; former pilgrim rest stop to the Abbey; now serves merchants, pedlars, and woodcutters.

enclaves.name: Swinney Tower

enclaves.name: Church of St Foggarty

resources.name: Political clout
resources.description: Official faith of the Duchy of Brackenwold and beyond; advises princes and duchesses and enforces edict while pursuing its own agenda.

resources.name: Holy Orders
resources.description: Three holy orders of warrior-priests (St Faxis, St Sedge, St Signis) able to muster force and prosecute church policy.

resources.name: Sanctioned battalions
resources.description: In concert with supportive nobles, the Church can muster significant armed forces from orders and sanctioned battalions.

resources.name: Cathedral and administration
resources.description: Cathedral of St Signis, Bishop’s Palace, and Seminary of 100 Martyrs form the administrative core in Castle Brackenwold.

resources.name: Ritual miracles
resources.description: High-ranking priests can channel divine power via elaborate rituals in consecrated sancta; rural vicars typically have no magic.

resources.name: Relics and saints
resources.description: Relics of saints have magical potency; worship focuses on saints as patrons, each church dedicated to a particular saint.

resources.name: The Refuge of St Keye
resources.description: The sole monastery in Dolmenwood, serving as a waypoint and information hub for merchants, pedlars, and woodcutters.

goals.name: Locate and restore the vanished wayside shrines
goals.notes: Shrines have disappeared over the last century; the Bishop seeks to re-sanctify them and suspects an arcane cause (Drune suspected).

goals.name: Rebuild the Abbey of St Clewyd (hex 0906)
goals.notes: Reconstruction would be the capstone of restoring church power in Dolmenwood; the Church incorrectly suspects Atanuwë’s involvement in the abbey’s destruction.

goals.name: Stamp out the Drune and witches
goals.notes: Under Bishop Sanguine the Church has grown antagonistic toward Drune and witches, inaccurately viewing them as devil-worshipping sects.

goals.name: Suppress undead and revenants
goals.notes: Order of St Signis (Lichwards) watches over the dead and hunts undead; fears crypts at the ruined abbey are becoming overrun.

goals.name: Maintain the Church’s political dominion
goals.notes: Leverage counsel and edict to influence nobles, preserve official-faith status, and subtly advance church agenda.

action_library.name: Dispatch clergy and lay brothers to locate vanished wayside shrines

on_complete.text: A lost wayside shrine has been rediscovered in the deep wood; pilgrims speak of fresh candles burning where none had stood for decades.

action_library.name: Re-sanctify a recovered shrine and install a saint’s icon

on_complete.text: Travellers report a newly consecrated roadside shrine; the saint’s sigil is fresh-carved and the air smells faintly of incense.

action_library.name: Investigate the cause of the disappearing shrines

on_complete.text: Church investigators whisper of an unseen hand unmaking holy places; some blame the Drune, others fear a darker power in the wood.

action_library.name: Send an expedition to survey the ruins of the Abbey of St Clewyd

on_complete.text: A battered church party returns from St Clewyd’s ruins with charcoal rubbings of strange marks and tales of cold echoes in the crypts.

action_library.name: Attempt to clear the abbey crypts of hostile forces

on_complete.text: For a night the bells of St Clewyd seem to ring again—then fall silent. Some claim the Church has driven back the dead, if only briefly.

action_library.name: Raise funds and secure craftsmen for rebuilding St Clewyd

on_complete.text: Tithes rise and masons are quietly contracted; the Church speaks again of restoring St Clewyd, though the Wood resists.

action_library.name: Conduct inquisitorial raids against suspected Drune and witches

on_complete.text: Black-robed clerics and armed men question villagers at dusk; the names of witches and Drune are spoken louder—and more fearfully.

action_library.name: Establish watch-posts to guard Church lands and roads

on_complete.text: Travellers find new patrols on the roads near Prigwort and Fort Vulgar; some feel safer, others feel watched.

action_library.name: Lichward patrols to suppress undead and restless spirits

on_complete.text: Gravediggers report fewer disturbances; a silent procession of indigo-robed clerics was seen returning to High-Hankle before dawn.

action_library.name: Seek the lost Hand of St Signis

on_complete.text: A rumour spreads that a bone-white relic hand has been borne from the Abbey crypts in a locked casket, its nails etched with liturgy.

action_library.name: Advise nobles and strengthen the Church’s hold over the Duchy

on_complete.text: Courtiers speak of new edicts in pious language; the Church’s counsellors seem to be everywhere in Castle Brackenwold.

core_doctrine: There exists but One True God; other deities are treated as aspects of God or ascended saints.
Evangelistic: aims to convert non-believers and bring them into the fold.
Daily practice centers on veneration of saints; each place of worship is dedicated to a patron saint.
history_notes: Arrived in Dolmenwood ~1,200 years ago; missionaries converted Gwyrae shrines into saint chapels and built a profusion of wayside shrines.
Over the last century, wayside shrines have disappeared, and folk-religion of old gods and spirits has resurged.

orders.name: Order of St Faxis
orders.edict: Root out practitioners of dark magic (devils, necromancy).

orders.name: Order of St Sedge
orders.edict: Protect Church lands from invaders; secure roads and shrines.

orders.name: Order of St Signis
orders.edict: Watch over the dead; hunt undead and restless spirits.

clergy.priests: From curates and village priests to archbishops; administer doctrine, rites, and local churches.
clergy.monastics: Ascetics; in Dolmenwood, effectively only the Refuge of St Keye remains.
clergy.friars: Wandering ascetics tasked with bringing the word to borderlands; loose affiliation with hierarchy; many saints were friars.

bishop_jospher_sanguine.appearance: Elderly human man with pasty skin, bald pate, hawkish nose, and pale blue penetrating eyes; episcopal purple finery with a ruby-encrusted gold medallion.
bishop_jospher_sanguine.demeanour: Neutral; vainglorious, condescending, coldly zealous; hatred of 'heathens' clouds his reason; grinds his teeth while listening.
desires: Restore the lost shrines of Dolmenwood and the dominance of the Church.
Eradicate witches and vestiges of the old Gwyrae religion.

rod_of_temperance.description: Ebony rod topped with a silver orb; allows wielder to perceive lies with ~50% accuracy; can cast Holy Quest and Reveal Alignment once a week.

elixir_of_st_eggort.description: 2-foot decanter of eternally radiant liquid; emanates bright sunlight in a 120-foot radius.

bishop_jospher_sanguine.servants: Several dozen assistants and librarians; several dozen household servants; Sanctus Primus (commander of the Order of St Faxis) is his right-hand man.

combat_stats.notes: Can cast holy spells up to Rank 5 by performing lengthy rituals in a specially consecrated sanctum.

abbot_nedwynne_hargle.appearance: Stiff, looming human man in late middle age with wide rustic face and unruly grey hair; simple tan robes of a librarian.
abbot_nedwynne_hargle.demeanour: Lawful; sombre, kindly, intellectual; ruffles his hair unconsciously.
desires: Discreet contact with the Drune about the status of the wards against the Cold Prince.
A quiet retirement in the High Wold countryside once the 'current troubles' are resolved.

knowledge.specialism: Lore of the Church, including history of the Triple Compact in Dolmenwood (now all but forgotten to the Church).
knowledge.services: Apply standard rules for hiring a sage; may sometimes provide research free of charge to servants of the Church.

abbot_nedwynne_hargle.servants: A dozen librarians and three personal servants.

combat_stats.notes: Can cast holy spells up to Rank 4 by performing lengthy rituals in a specially consecrated sanctum.

hilda_harrowmoor.title: Commander of the Order of St Sedge
hilda_harrowmoor.appearance: Tall, brawny human woman in late twenties with cascading black curls, blazing blue eyes, and a wide expressive mouth; stark military garb with plain white tabard.
hilda_harrowmoor.demeanour: Lawful; hard-headed pragmatist, accomplished tactician; little interest in theory.

speech.style: Eloquent and forthright; prone to inspiring speeches.

desires: Convince Captain Hogwash of the real crookhorn threat in central Dolmenwood, drawing attention away from trivial matters in Prigwort.

shield_of_harrowmoor.description: Great Holy Shield bearing the Harrowmoor coat of arms.

hilda_harrowmoor.servants: Troop of eight clerics of the Order of St Sedge and six soldiers of House Harrowmoor.

joan_ablewright.title: Commander of the Order of St Signis
joan_ablewright.appearance: Elderly human woman with stern brown eyes, furrowed brow, half-moon spectacles on a crooked nose, and thin shoulder-length hair streaked with grey; ivy-crowned skull medallion and elaborately pleated indigo robes.

speech.style: Hushed, punctuated with formal macabre phrases.

desires: Word on the current state of the ruined Abbey of St Clewyd (fears the crypts are becoming overrun by undead).
Possession of the lost Hand of St Signis (rumoured to be in the abbey crypts).
Aid Duchess Ophelia in solving the mystery of her daughter Persimone’s death.

stifling_mallet.description: Bone-handled flanged Holy Mace (Undead Bane) able to cast Silence once per day.

joan_ablewright.servants: Twelve clerics of the Order of St Signis.

sanctus_primus.title: Commander of the Order of St Faxis
sanctus_primus.appearance: Robust, handsome human man in late forties with square jaw, cropped hair, and deep grey wide-set eyes; sombre black robes with golden symbol of St Faxis (three crossed swords) on a chain.
sanctus_primus.demeanour: Neutral; hard-line scripturalist, unwaveringly loyal, ruthlessly ambitious.

speech.style: Silver-tongued; careful enunciation belies working-class roots.

desires: Keep his liaisons with One-Eyed Gil (landlady of the Poppy Cock) utterly secret.
Be announced as the bishop’s official successor.
Obtain evidence of Abbot Hargle’s entanglement with dark powers.

rod_of_bless_weapon.description: Ebony Rod of Bless Weapon engraved with liturgies to St Faxis.

sanctus_primus.servants: Fifteen clerics of the Order of St Faxis.

saints_d100.notes: The 100 saints venerated in Dolmenwood. Formatting in the source distinguishes 34 major saints; this JSON preserves names and roll values but does not mark major saints due to lost italics in extraction.

ruined_abbey_st_clewyd.summary: Former capstone of Church power in Dolmenwood; now ruined and purportedly haunted; attempts to clear it have failed.
hooks: Crypts may be becoming overrun by undead.
Lost relics rumored within (e.g., the Hand of St Signis).

lore.fall_of_st_howarth: St Howarth (once 'the Just') is accursed after betraying the archangel Heroclesius to devils; cast out from heaven and miracles reversed. See hexes 0512 and 0610.
lore.shrines: Wayside shrines have been disappearing over the last century; Church suspects arcane cause and blames Drune.

references.source: Dolmenwood - Factions and Powers (Pluritine Church entry)
